title: Setting Up
text: Set up three equatinos in variable form to represent the situation $$(s=Saudi$$ Arabi, $$m=Mexico$$, and $$c=Canada)$$. We have $$s+m+c=47$$, $$m+1.8=s$$, and $$c+1.7=s$$

title: Simplifying to $$1$$ Variable
text: Plug in $$m=s-1.8$$ and $$c=s-1.7$$ into the equation containing all three variables so that only one variable s is present

title: Solving for s
text: Combine the s values and solve for s using algebra

title: Solving for
text: Plug in the value of s into $$m=s-1.8$$ to solve for $$m$$

title: Solving for
text: Plug in the value of s into $$c=s-1.7$$ to solve for c
